channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2015 The New York Times Company

item.title: Nicki Minaj Concert in Angola Draws Human Rights Complaint
item.description: The rapper shouldn’t do business with the country’s “corrupt” dictatorship, the Human Rights Foundation said.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: KATIE ROGERS
item.media:description: The Human Rights Foundation is asking Nicki Minaj to reconsider her scheduled performance in the oil-rich nation this weekend.

item.title: U.S. Defense Chief Confers With Iraqi Officials on ISIS Campaign
item.description: Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter met with Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi and Khaled al-Obeidi, the Iraqi defense minister, to discuss steps to speed up the fight against the Islamic State.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL R. GORDON

item.title: Jerusalem Attacks Subside, but Not Palestinian Ire, as Israel Clamps Down
item.description: Most attacks are now carried out by Palestinians from the West Bank, rather than East Jerusalem, but some predict that Israel’s tough policies will backfire.
item.dc:creator: DIAA HADID and RAMI NAZZAL

item.title: World Briefing: Trade War Escalates Between Russia and Ukraine
item.description: Ukraine’s cabinet voted to stop trade with Crimea beginning in mid-January, and Russia signed a decree excluding Ukraine from a trade bloc of former Soviet states on Jan. 1.
item.dc:creator: ALEXANDRA ODYNOVA

item.title: In 2015, E.U. Faced Threats From Outside and Within
item.description: Chief issues for Europe include terrorist attacks, refugees, the weakened euro, the belligerence of Russia and the doubts about the union expressed by Britain.
item.dc:creator: JEFFREY MARCUS
item.media:credit: Mauricio Lima for The New York Times
item.media:description: A man in Mithymna, on the Greek island of Lesbos, stood in pile of discarded life vests, inner tubes and deflated rubber rafts used by refugees to cross the Aegean Sea from Turkey to Greece.

item.title: Yemeni Sides Agree to Prisoner Swap, as Peace Talks Begin in Switzerland
item.description: The Yemeni government and Houthi rebels agreed to release hundreds of prisoners as the groups sat down for negotiations aimed at ending the country’s civil war.
item.dc:creator: SAEED AL-BATATI and KAREEM FAHIM

item.title: Qatari Safari Members, Including Royalty, Are Abducted in Iraq
item.description: Gunmen in the southern Iraqi desert near the border with Saudi Arabia overwhelmed a tent encampment and kidnapped at least 26 members of an expedition.
item.dc:creator: OMAR AL-JAWOSHY and RICK GLADSTONE

item.title: Pope Francis, Reminding That Salvation Is Free, Warns Against Fraudsters
item.description: There is no fee for passing through the Holy Door, a symbol of the threshold to salvation, Pope Francis said at his weekly address.
item.dc:creator: DANIEL VICTOR

item.title: Ethiopians on Edge as Infrastructure Plan Stirs Protests
item.description: Violent confrontations have erupted over an urban plan that would link infrastructure development in Addis Ababa with that of surrounding towns home to the Oromo ethnic group.
item.dc:creator: JACEY FORTIN

item.title: Open Source: Pakistan Surprised to Be Included in Saudi-Led Alliance It Never Heard Of
item.description: Officials in Pakistan said that they were not consulted by Saudi Arabia before their nation was described as a member of a new military alliance.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: ROBERT MACKEY

item.title: Judge Leaves Northern Ireland’s Abortion Laws to Lawmakers
item.description: Judge Mark Horner said that ordering changes to allow terminations in the case of a fatal fetal abnormality, rape or incest would be “a step too far.”
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: DOUGLAS DALBY

item.title: British Court Rejects Donald Trump’s Attempt to Block Wind Farm
item.description: The Supreme Court turned down an attempt by Mr. Trump to block the construction of turbines near his luxury golf resort in northeast Scotland.
item.dc:creator: SEWELL CHAN
item.media:description: Donald J. Trump at the Trump International Golf Links course in Balmedie, Scotland, in 2012.

item.title: Thousands March in South Africa to Call for President’s Resignation
item.description: Protesters demanded that Jacob Zuma step down after his choice for finance minister raised widespread concerns about his handling of the economy.
item.dc:creator: NORIMITSU ONISHI
item.media:description: Protesters calling for the resignation of President Jacob Zuma in Johannesburg on Wednesday.

item.title: Memo From Pakistan: Pakistan Military Deals a Blow to Jihadists but Not to Ideology
item.description: The reality in the region is that hard-line practices in line with some of the most conservative Saudi teachings are more mainstream than ever.
item.dc:creator: ROD NORDLAND
item.media:description: Maulana Abdul Aziz, center, the radical preacher of the Red Mosque, at a news conference in Islamabad, Pakistan, in 2014.

item.title: India, Choking on Pollution, Restricts Vehicle Use in New Delhi
item.description: The Supreme Court issued a temporary ban on the registration of some diesel cars and ordered all taxis in the region to switch to compressed natural gas by March 1.
item.dc:creator: NIDA NAJAR
item.media:description: A busy road in New Delhi, the capital of India. The World Health Organization said last year that New Delhi had the most polluted air of the nearly 1,600 cities it surveyed.

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: Stick to Sanctions on Russia
item.description: The West must not sell out Ukraine to join Putin’s alliance against ISIS.
item.dc:creator: ANDREW FOXALL

item.title: U.S. Calls for Investigation of Shiite Deaths in Nigeria
item.description: Up to 1,000 members of a Shiite sect may have been killed in an attack Nigeria’s military blames on the sect.
item.dc:creator: SEWELL CHAN

item.title: Suspect in Xinjiang Mine Attack Spoke of Jihad, Chinese News Reports Say
item.description: The state-run news media released a televised confession of one man, and identified two other suspects in the assault.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL FORSYTHE

item.title: North Korea Sentences Canadian Pastor to Life in Prison
item.description: The Rev. Lim Hyeon-soo of suburban Toronto was the latest missionary convicted of subversive and “anti-state” crimes.
item.dc:creator: CHOE SANG-HUN

item.title: Japan’s Top Court Upholds Law Requiring Spouses to Share Surname
item.description: One justice said the law did not impose an undue burden on women in part because they could continue using their maiden names in their professional lives.
item.dc:creator: JONATHAN SOBLE
item.media:description: A traditional wedding ceremony at a shrine in Tokyo. Married couples in Japan are required to share the same surname.
